frame.name: Medical_conditions
frame.definition:
<def-root>Words in this frame name medical conditions or diseases that a patient suffers from, is being treated for, may be cured of, or die of. The condition or disease may be described in a variety of ways, including the part or area of the body (<fen>Body_Part</fen>) affected by the condition (e.g. liver cancer, cardiovascular disease), the <fen>Cause</fen> of the condition (e.g. bacterial meningitis, viral pneumonia), a prominent <fen>Symptom</fen> of the condition (e.g. asymptomatic stenosis, blue ear disease), the <fen>Patient</fen> or population (originally) affected by the condition (e.g. bovine tuberculosis, juvenile diabetes), or the (proper) <fen>Name</fen> used to identify the condition (e.g. Munchausen Syndrome, Lou Gehrig's Disease). Annotation in this frame is done in respect to the name of the condition or disease.
<ex>John died of <fex name="Body_P">pancreatic</fex> <t>cancer</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Patient
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for the patient, entity, or population (originally) affected by the condition or illness.
<ex><fex name="Patient">juvenile</fex> <t>diabetes</t></ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">Dutch Elm</fex> <t>disease</t></ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">Legionnaire's</fex> <t>disease</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body_Part
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Body_Part</fen> is used for the part or area of the body affected by the condition or disease. <ex><fex name="Body_P">cardiovascular</fex> <t>disease</t></ex> <ex><fex name="Body_P">liver</fex> <t>disease</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for the cause of a condition or disease. <ex><fex name="Cause">bacterial</fex> <t>meningitis</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Symptom
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for a prominent symptom of the condition or disease.
<ex><fex name="Symptom">asymptomatic</fex> <t>stenosis</t></ex> <ex>I have a <t>cold</t> <fex name="Symptom">with a really bad cough</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for the <fen>Name</fen> that identifies the condition or disease.
<ex><fex name="Name">Munchausen</fex> <t>Syndrome</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Ailment</fen> diverges from the norm.
<ex>I am <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>sick</t>.</ex>
Since the degree of involvement with an <fen>Ailment</fen> is equivalent to how negative the experience of the <fen>Patient</fen> is, in many cases, <fen>Degree</fen> is expressed by a negative descriptor.
<ex>It seems that he does have <fex name="Degree">very severe</fex> <t>eczema</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Ailment</fen> is effecting the <fen>Patient</fen>s.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: acromegaly.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: abnormal growth of the hands, feet, and face, caused by overproduction of growth hormone by the pituitary gland

lexUnit.name: amnesia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a partial or total loss of memory

lexUnit.name: arthritis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a disease causing painful inflammation and stiffness of the joints

lexUnit.name: anorexia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: lack of appetite for food, in particular also anorexia nervosa an emotional disorder characterized by an obsessive desire to lose weight by refusing to eat

lexUnit.name: asphyxia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a condition arising when the body is deprived of oxygen, causing unconsciousness or death

lexUnit.name: asthma.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a respiratory condition marked by attacks of spasm in the bronchi of the lungs, causing difficulty in breathing and usually associated with allergic reaction

lexUnit.name: bronchitis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: inflammation of the mucous membrane in the bronchial tubes, typically with spasm of bronchial muscle and coughing

lexUnit.name: cancer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a disease caused by an uncontrolled division of abnormal cells in a part of the body.

lexUnit.name: candida.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a yeast-like parasitic fungus that sometimes causes thrush

lexUnit.name: cataract.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a medical condition in which the lens of the eye becomes progressively opaque, resulting in blurred vision

lexUnit.name: cholangitis.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: inflammation of the bile ducts.

lexUnit.name: cholecystitis.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: inflammation of the gallbladder, usually caused by the presence of gallstones.

lexUnit.name: cholera.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an infectious and often fatal bacterial disease of the small intestine, typically contracted from infected water supplies and causing severe vomiting and diarrhoea

lexUnit.name: cirrhosis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a chronic liver disease marked by degeneration of cells, inflammation, and thickening of tissue

lexUnit.name: cold.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a common infection in which the mucous membrane of the nose and throat becomes inflamed, causing running at the nose and sneezing

lexUnit.name: colitis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: inflammation of the lining of the colon

lexUnit.name: conjunctivitis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: inflammation of the conjunctiva

lexUnit.name: cryptosporidiosis.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a diarrheal disease caused by a microscopic parasite (Cryptosporidium parvum).

lexUnit.name: diarrhea.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a condition in which faeces are discharged from the bowels frequently and in a liquid form

lexUnit.name: depression.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: severe despondency and dejection, especially when long-lasting

lexUnit.name: dermatitis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: inflammation of the skin as a result of irritation by or allergic reaction to an external agent

lexUnit.name: diabetes.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a disorder of the metabolism causing excessive thirst and the production of large amounts of urine

lexUnit.name: diphtheria.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a serious bacterial disease causing inflammation of the mucous membranes and formation of a false membrane in the throat which hinders breathing and swallowing

lexUnit.name: diverticulosis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a condition in which diverticula are present in the intestine without signs of inflammation

lexUnit.name: dysmenorrhoea.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: painful menstruation

lexUnit.name: eczema.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a medical condition in which patches of skin become rough and inflamed with blisters which cause itching and bleeding

lexUnit.name: flu.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: influenza or any similar, milder infection

lexUnit.name: influenza.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a highly contagious viral infection of the respiratory passages causing fever, severe aching, and coughing

lexUnit.name: hepatitis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a disease characterized by inflammation of the liver

lexUnit.name: hernia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a condition in which part of an organ (most commonly, the intestine) is displaced and protrudes through the wall of the cavity containing it

lexUnit.name: hypertension.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: abnormally high blood pressure

lexUnit.name: hypoglycaemia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: deficiency of glucose in the bloodstream

lexUnit.name: illness.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a disease or period of sickness

lexUnit.name: disease.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a disorder of structure or function in a human, animal, or plant, especially one that produces specific symptoms or that affects a specific part

lexUnit.name: sickness.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state of being ill

lexUnit.name: infection.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an infectious disease

lexUnit.name: jaundice.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: yellowing of the skin due to an excess of bile pigments in the blood

lexUnit.name: leprosy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a contagious bacterial disease that affects the skin, mucous membranes, and nerves, causing discoloration and lumps on the skin and, in severe cases, disfigurement and deformities

lexUnit.name: leukemia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a malignant progressive disease in which the bone marrow and other blood-forming organs produce increased numbers of immature or abnormal leucocytes, suppressing the production of normal blood cells

lexUnit.name: malaria.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a mosquito-borne intermittent and remittent fever endemic to warmer regions and caused by a protozoan parasite (genus Plasmodium)

lexUnit.name: measles.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an infectious viral disease causing fever and a red rash, typically occurring in childhood

lexUnit.name: meningitis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a disease in which there is inflammation of the meninges, caused by viral or bacterial infection

lexUnit.name: menorrhagia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: abnormally heavy bleeding at menstruation

lexUnit.name: polio.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: short for poliomyelitis

lexUnit.name: psoriasis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a skin disease marked by red, itchy, scaly patches

lexUnit.name: pyelonephritis.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: infection of the kidneys.

lexUnit.name: rosacea.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a condition in which certain facial blood vessels enlarge, giving the cheeks and nose a flushed appearance

lexUnit.name: schizophrenia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long-term mental disorder of a type involving a breakdown in the relation between thought, emotion, and behaviour, leading to faulty perception, inappropriate actions and feelings, and withdrawal from reality into fantasy and delusion

lexUnit.name: sciatica.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pain affecting the back, hip, and outer side of the leg, caused by compression of a spinal nerve root in the lower back

lexUnit.name: shock.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an acute medical condition associated with a fall in blood pressure, caused by loss of blood, severe burns, sudden emotional stress, etc.

lexUnit.name: stress.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a state of mental, emotional, or other strain

lexUnit.name: strongylosis.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: infestation of strongyle worms.

lexUnit.name: syphilis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sexually transmitted bacterial disease, progressing if untreated from infection of the genitals via the skin and mucous membranes to the bones, muscles, and brain

lexUnit.name: tetanus.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a bacterial disease causing rigidity and spasms of the voluntary muscles

lexUnit.name: tuberculosis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an infectious bacterial disease characterized by the growth of nodules (tubercles) in the tissues, especially the lungs

lexUnit.name: tumor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a swelling of a part of the body, generally without inflammation, caused by an abnormal growth of tissue, whether benign or malignant

lexUnit.name: ulcer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an open sore on an external or internal surface of the body, caused by a break in the skin or mucous membrane which fails to heal

lexUnit.name: rubella.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a contagious viral disease, with symptoms like mild measles; German measles

lexUnit.name: mumps.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a viral disease mainly affecting children, causing swelling of the parotid salivary glands of the face

lexUnit.name: bacterial meningitis.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an infection of the fluid of a person's spinal cord and the fluid that surrounds the brain caused by a bacteria (as opposed to a virus)

lexUnit.name: German measles.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: another term for rubella.

lexUnit.name: ailment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a minor illness.

lexUnit.name: wound.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an injury to living tissue caused by a cut, blow, or other impact.

lexUnit.name: affliction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: ailment.

lexUnit.name: condition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an illness or medical problem.

lexUnit.name: syndrome.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an illness characterized by a group of symptoms occurring together.

lexUnit.name: stenosis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the abnormal narrowing of a passage in the body.

lexUnit.name: sick.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: affected by physical or mental illness.

lexUnit.name: ill.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not in full health; unwell.

lexUnit.name: unwell.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: ill.

lexUnit.name: health.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state of being free from illness or injury.

lexUnit.name: plague.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a contagious bacterial disease characterized by fever and delirium, typically with the formation of buboes (see bubonic plague) and sometimes infection of the lungs (pneumonic plague).

lexUnit.name: malnourishment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of not being poorly nourished becuase of lack of food.

lexUnit.name: malnutrition.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the affliction of being undernourished

lexUnit.name: paraplegic.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: being paralyzed from the waist down

lexUnit.name: healthy.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: in good health; not ill

lexUnit.name: AIDS.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a disease, caused by a virus transmitted in body fluids, in which there is a severe loss of cellular immunity leaving the sufferer susceptible to infection and malignancy

lexUnit.name: Alzheimer's.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a form of progressive mental deterioration due to generalized degeneration of the brain, occurring in middle or old age.

lexUnit.name: disorder.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a disruption of normal physical or mental functions
